010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
028import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
029
030import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.DivideByZeroException;
031
032/**
033 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
034 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
035 * objects structures. 
036 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
037 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
038 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
039 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
040 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
041 * 
042 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
043 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
044 * 
045 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
046 * 
047 * @author W. Burger
048 * @version 2022/06/21
049 */
050public abstract class Matrix {
051        
052        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
053        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
054        
055        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
056        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
057        
058        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
059        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
060        
061        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
062        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
063        
064        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
065        
066        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
067                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
068                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
069                        return A;
070                }
071                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
072                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
073                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
074                }
075                
076                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
077                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
078                                A[r][c] = values[i];
079                                i++;
080                        }
081                }               
082                return A;
083        }
084        
085        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
086                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
087                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
088                        return A;
089                }
090                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
091                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
092                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
093                }       
094                
095                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
096                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
097                                A[r][c] = values[i];
098                                i++;
099                        }
100                }               
101                return A;
102        }
103        
104        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
105                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
106        }
107        
108        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
109                return values;
110        }
111        
112        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
113                return values;
114        }
115        
116        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
117                //return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
118                return new ArrayRealVector(values);
119        }
120        
121        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
122        
123        /**
124         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double} vector of the 
125         * specified length.
126         * @param length the length of the vector
127         * @return a vector with zero values
128         */
129        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
130                if (length < 1)
131                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
132                return new double[length];
133        }
134        
135        /**
136         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
137         * specified size.
138         * @param size the size of the matrix
139         * @return an identity matrix
140         */
141        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
142                if (size < 1)
143                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
144                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
145                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
146                        A[i][i] = 1;
147                }
148                return A;
149        }
150        
151        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
152
153        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
154                return A.length;
155        }
156        
157        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
158                return A[0].length;
159        }
160        
161        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
162                return A.length;
163        }
164        
165        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
166                return A[0].length;
167        }
168        
169        // Extract rows or columns
170        
171        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
172                return A[r].clone();
173        }
174        
175        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
176                final int rows = A.length;
177                double[] col = new double[rows];
178                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
179                        col[r] = A[r][c];
180                }
181                return col;
182        }
183        
184        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
185        
186        /**
187         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
188         * @param A a matrix
189         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
190         */
191        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
192                final int nCols = A[0].length;
193                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
194                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
195                                return false;
196                        }
197                }
198                return true;
199        }
200        
201        /**
202         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
203         * @param A a matrix
204         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
205         */
206        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
207                final int nCols = A[0].length;
208                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
209                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
210                                return false;
211                        }
212                }
213                return true;
214        }
215        
216        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
217         * and columns.
218         * @param A a matrix
219         * @return true iff the matrix is square
220         */
221        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
222                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
223        }
224        
225        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
226         * and columns.
227         * @param A a matrix
228         * @return true iff the matrix is square
229         */
230        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
231                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
232        }
233        
234        /**
235         * TODO: implement!
236         * @param A a matrix
237         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
238         */
239        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
240                return null;
241        }
242        
243        
244        /**
245         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
246         * @param A a square matrix
247         * @return true if the matrix is singular
248         */
249        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
250                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
251                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
252                }               
253                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));         
254        }
255        
256        /**
257         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
258         * @param A a square matrix
259         * @return true if the matrix is singular
260         */
261        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
262                if (!A.isSquare()) {
263                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
264                }               
265                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
266                return !solver.isNonSingular();
267        }
268        
269        
270        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
271        
272        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
273                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
274        }
275        
276        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
277                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
278        }
279        
280        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
281                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
282        }
283        
284        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
285                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
286        }
287        
288        /**
289         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
290         * TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
291         * @param A a square matrix
292         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
293         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
294         */
295        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) {
296                try {
297                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
298                        return true;
299                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
300                return false;
301        }
302        
303        /**
304         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
305         * @param A a square matrix
306         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
307         */
308        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
309                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
310        }
311        
312        /**
313         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
314         * @param a first vector
315         * @param b second vector
316         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
317         */
318        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
319                return a.length == b.length;
320        }
321        
322        /**
323         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
324         * @param a first vector
325         * @param b second vector
326         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
327         */
328        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
329                return a.length == b.length;
330        }
331        
332        /**
333         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
334         * @param A first matrix
335         * @param B second matrix
336         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
337         */
338        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
339                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
340        }
341        
342        /**
343         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
344         * @param A first matrix
345         * @param B second matrix
346         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
347         */
348        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
349                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
350        }
351
352        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
353
354        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
355                return A.clone();
356        }
357        
358        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
359                return A.clone();
360        }
361
362        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
363                final int m = A.length;
364                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
365                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
366                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
367                }
368                return B;
369        }
370        
371        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
372                final int m = A.length;
373                float[][] B = new float[m][];
374                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
375                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
376                }
377                return B;
378        }
379        
380        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
381        
382        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
383                final int m = A.length;
384                final float[] B = new float[m];
385                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
386                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
387                }
388                return B;
389        }
390        
391        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
392                final int m = A.length;
393                final int n = A[0].length;
394                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
395                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
396                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
397                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
398                        }
399                }
400                return B;
401        }
402        
403        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
404                final int m = A.length;
405                final double[] B = new double[m];
406                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
407                        B[i] = A[i];
408                }
409                return B;
410        }
411        
412        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
413                final int m = A.length;
414                final int n = A[0].length;
415                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
416                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
417                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
418                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
419                        }
420                }
421                return B;
422        }
423        
424        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
425        
426        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
427                Arrays.fill(A, val);
428        }
429        
430        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
431                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
432                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
433                }
434        }
435        
436        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
437                Arrays.fill(A, val);
438        }
439        
440        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
441                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
442                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
443                }
444        }
445        
446        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
447        
448        // non-destructive
449        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
450                double[] c = b.clone();
451                addD(a, c);
452                return c;
453        }
454        
455        // destructive, b is modified
456        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
457                if (!sameSize(a, b))
458                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
459                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
460                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
461                }
462        }
463        
464        // non-destructive
465        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
466                float[] c = b.clone();
467                addD(a, c);
468                return c;
469        }
470        
471        // destructive, b is modified
472        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
473                if (!sameSize(a, b))
474                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
475                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
476                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
477                }
478        }
479
480        // non-destructive
481        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
482                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
483                addD(A, C);
484                return C;
485        }
486        
487        // destructive, B is modified
488        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
489                if (!sameSize(A, B))
490                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
491                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
492                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
493                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
494                        }
495                }
496        }
497        
498        // non-destructive
499        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
500                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
501                addD(A, C);
502                return C;
503        }
504        
505        // destructive, B is modified
506        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
507                if (!sameSize(A, B))
508                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
509                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
510                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
511                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
512                        }
513                }
514        }
515        
516        // ------------------------------------------------
517        
518        // non-destructive a - b
519        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
520                if (!sameSize(a, b))
521                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
522                final int n = a.length;
523                double[] c = new double[n];
524                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
525                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
526                }
527                return c;
528        }
529        
530        // non-destructive a - b
531        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
532                if (!sameSize(a, b))
533                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
534                final int n = a.length;
535                float[] c = new float[n];
536                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
537                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
538                }
539                return c;
540        }
541
542        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
543
544        // non-destructive
545        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
546                double[] b = a.clone();
547                multiplyD(s, b);
548                return b;
549        }
550        
551        // destructive
552        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
553                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
554                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
555                }
556        }
557        
558
559        // non-destructive
560        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
561                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
562                multiplyD(s, B);
563                return B;
564        }
565        
566        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
567                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
568                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
569                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
570                        }
571                }
572        }
573        
574        // non-destructive
575        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
576                float[] B = duplicate(A);
577                multiplyD(s, B);
578                return B;
579        }
580        
581        // destructive
582        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
583                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
584                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
585                }
586        }
587
588        // non-destructive
589        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
590                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
591                multiplyD(s, B);
592                return B;
593        }
594        
595        // destructive
596        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
597                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
598                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
599                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
600                        }
601                }
602        }
603        
604        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
605
606        /**
607         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
608         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
609         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
610         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
611         * @return a (row) vector of length n
612         */
613        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
614                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
615                multiplyD(x, A, y);
616                return y;
617        }
618        
619        /**
620         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
621         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
622         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
623         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
624         */
625        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
626                if (x == y) 
627                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
628                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
629                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
630                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
631                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
632                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
633                        double s = 0;
634                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
635                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
636                        }
637                        y[i] = s;
638                }
639        }
640
641        /**
642         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
643         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
644         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
645         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
646         * @return a (column) vector of length m
647         */
648        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
649                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
650                multiplyD(A, x, y);
651                return y;
652        }
653        
654        /**
655         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
656         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
657         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
658         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
659         */
660        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
661                if (x == y) 
662                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
663                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
664                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
665                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
666                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
667                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
668                        double s = 0;
669                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
670                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
671                        }
672                        y[i] = s;
673                }
674        }
675        
676        /**
677         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
678         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
679         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
680         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
681         * @return a (column) vector of length m
682         */
683        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
684                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
685                multiplyD(A, x, y);
686                return y;
687        }
688        
689        /**
690         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
691         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
692         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
693         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
694         */
695        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
696                if (x == y) 
697                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
698                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
699                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
700                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
701                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
702                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
703                        double s = 0;
704                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
705                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
706                        }
707                        y[i] = (float) s;
708                }
709        }
710        
711
712        
713        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
714        
715        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
716        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
717                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
718                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
719                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(m, q);
720                multiplyD(A, B, C);
721                return C;
722        }
723        
724        // A * B -> C (destructive)
725        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
726                if (A == C || B == C) 
727                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
728                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
729                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
730                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
731                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
732                if (nA != mB)
733                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
734                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
735                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
736                                double s = 0;
737                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
738                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
739                                }
740                                C[i][j] = s;
741                        }
742                }
743        }
744        
745        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
746        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
747                // TODO: also check nA = mB
748                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
749                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
750                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
751                multiplyD(A, B, C);
752                return C;
753        }
754
755        // A * B -> C (destructive)
756        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
757                if (A == C || B == C) 
758                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
759                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
760                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
761                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
762                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
763                if (nA != mB)
764                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
765                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
766                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
767                                float s = 0;
768                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
769                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
770                                }
771                                C[i][j] = s;
772                        }
773                }
774        }
775        
776        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
777        
778        /**
779         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
780         * which must have the same length.
781         * @param x first vector
782         * @param y second vector
783         * @return the dot product
784         */
785        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
786                if (!sameSize(x, y))
787                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
788                double sum = 0;
789                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
790                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
791                }
792                return sum;
793        }
794        
795        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
796        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
797        /**
798         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
799         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
800         * m is the length of the second vector.
801         * @param x first vector (of length m)
802         * @param y second vector (of length n)
803         * @return the outer product (matrix)
804         */
805        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
806                final int m = x.length;
807                final int n = y.length;
808                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
809                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
810                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
811                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
812                        }
813                }
814                return M;
815        }
816
817        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
818
819        /**
820         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
821         * @param x a vector
822         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
823         */
824        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
825                double sum = 0;
826                for (double val : x) {
827                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
828                }
829                return sum;
830        }
831
832        /**
833         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
834         * @param x a vector
835         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
836         */
837        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
838                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
839        }
840
841        /**
842         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
843         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
844         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
845         * @param x a vector
846         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
847         */
848        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
849                double sum = 0;
850                for (double val : x) {
851                        sum = sum + (val * val);
852                }
853                return sum;
854        }
855        
856        /**
857         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
858         * @param x a vector
859         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
860         */
861        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
862                double sum = 0;
863                for (double val : x) {
864                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
865                }
866                return (float) sum;
867        }
868
869        /**
870         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
871         * @param x a vector
872         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
873         */
874        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
875                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
876        }
877
878        /**
879         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
880         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
881         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
882         * @param x a vector
883         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
884         */
885        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
886                double sum = 0;
887                for (double val : x) {
888                        sum = sum + (val * val);
889                }
890                return (float) sum;
891        }
892        
893        // Normalize vectors
894        
895        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
896                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
897                normalizeD(xx);
898                return xx;
899        }
900        
901        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
902                multiplyD(1.0 / normL2(x), x);
903        }
904        
905        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
906        
907        /** 
908         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
909         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
910         * number of elements.
911         * @param x first vector
912         * @param y second vector
913         * @return the distance
914         */
915        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
916                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
917        }
918        
919        /** 
920         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
921         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
922         * number of elements.
923         * @param x first vector
924         * @param y second vector
925         * @return the squared distance
926         */
927        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
928                double sum = 0;
929                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
930                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
931                }
932                return sum;
933        }
934        
935        /** 
936         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
937         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
938         * number of elements.
939         * @param x first vector
940         * @param y second vector
941         * @return the distance
942         */
943        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
944                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
945        }
946        
947        /** 
948         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
949         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
950         * number of elements.
951         * @param x first vector
952         * @param y second vector
953         * @return the squared distance
954         */
955        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
956                double sum = 0;
957                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
958                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
959                }
960                return (float) sum;
961        }
962        
963        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
964        
965        /**
966         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
967         * @param A a matrix
968         * @return the norm of the matrix
969         */
970        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
971                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
972                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
973                double s = 0;
974                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
975                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
976                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
977                        }
978                }
979                return Math.sqrt(s);
980        }
981
982        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
983
984        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
985                double sum = 0;
986                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
987                        sum = sum + x[i];
988                }
989                return sum;
990        }
991        
992        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
993                double sum = 0;
994                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
995                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
996                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
997                        }
998                }
999                return sum;
1000        }
1001        
1002        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
1003                double sum = 0;
1004                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1005                        sum = sum + x[i];
1006                }
1007                return (float) sum;
1008        }
1009        
1010        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1011                double sum = 0;
1012                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1013                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1014                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1015                        }
1016                }
1017                return sum;
1018        }
1019        
1020        // --------------------------------------------------
1021        
1022        /**
1023         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1024         * @param A a matrix
1025         * @param row the row index
1026         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1027         */
1028        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1029                return sum(A[row]);
1030        }
1031        
1032        /**
1033         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1034         * @param A a matrix
1035         * @param row the row index
1036         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1037         */
1038        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1039                return sum(A[row]);
1040        }
1041        
1042
1043        /**
1044         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1045         * @param A a matrix
1046         * @param col the column index
1047         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1048         */
1049        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1050                double sum = 0;
1051                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1052                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1053                }
1054                return sum;
1055        }
1056        
1057        /**
1058         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1059         * @param A a matrix
1060         * @param col the column index
1061         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1062         */
1063        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1064                double sum = 0;
1065                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1066                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1067                }
1068                return (float) sum;
1069        }
1070        
1071        /**
1072         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1073         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1074         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1075         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1076         */
1077        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1078                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1079                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1080                        double sum = 0;
1081                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1082                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1083                        }
1084                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1085                }
1086                return sumVec;
1087        }
1088        
1089        /**
1090         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1091         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1092         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1093         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1094         */
1095        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1096                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1097                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1098                        double sum = 0;
1099                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1100                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1101                        }
1102                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1103                }
1104                return sumVec;
1105        }
1106        
1107        /**
1108         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1109         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1110         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1111         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1112         */
1113        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1114                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1115                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1116                        double sum = 0;
1117                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1118                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1119                        }
1120                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1121                }
1122                return sumVec;
1123        }
1124        
1125        /**
1126         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1127         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1128         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1129         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1130         */
1131        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1132                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1133                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1134                        double sum = 0;
1135                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1136                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1137                        }
1138                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1139                }
1140                return sumVec;
1141        }
1142        
1143        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1144        
1145        // TODO:  testing,  add float version
1146        /**
1147         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1148         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1149         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1150         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1151         * 
1152         * @param x a vector
1153         * @return the index of the smallest value
1154         */
1155        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1156                if (x.length == 0)
1157                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1158                double minval = x[0];
1159                int minidx = 0;
1160                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1161                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1162                                minval = x[i];
1163                                minidx = i;
1164                        }
1165                }
1166                return minidx;
1167        }
1168        
1169        // TODO: testing, add float version
1170        /**
1171         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1172         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1173         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1174         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1175         * 
1176         * @param x a vector
1177         * @return the index of the largest value
1178         */
1179        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1180                if (x.length == 0)
1181                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1182                double maxval = x[0];
1183                int maxidx = 0;
1184                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1185                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1186                                maxval = x[i];
1187                                maxidx = i;
1188                        }
1189                }
1190                return maxidx;
1191        }
1192        
1193        
1194        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1195                if (x.length == 0)
1196                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1197                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1198                for (float val : x) {
1199                        if (val < minval) {
1200                                minval = val;
1201                        }
1202                }
1203                return minval;
1204        }
1205        
1206        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1207                if (x.length == 0)
1208                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1209                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1210                for (double val : x) {
1211                        if (val < minval) {
1212                                minval = val;
1213                        }
1214                }
1215                return minval;
1216        }
1217        
1218
1219        
1220        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1221                if (x.length == 0)
1222                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1223                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1224                for (float val : x) {
1225                        if (val > maxval) {
1226                                maxval = val;
1227                        }
1228                }
1229                return maxval;
1230        }
1231        
1232        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1233                if (x.length == 0)
1234                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1235                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1236                for (double val : x) {
1237                        if (val > maxval) {
1238                                maxval = val;
1239                        }
1240                }
1241                return maxval;
1242        }
1243        
1244        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1245                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1246                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1247                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1248                                if (val > maxval) {
1249                                        maxval = val;
1250                                }
1251                        }
1252                }
1253                return maxval;
1254        }
1255        
1256        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1257                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1258                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1259                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1260                                if (val > maxval) {
1261                                        maxval = val;
1262                                }
1263                        }
1264                }
1265                return maxval;
1266        }
1267        
1268        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1269        
1270        /**
1271         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1272         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1273         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1274         */
1275        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1276                int n = 0;
1277                for (float[] x : xs) {
1278                        n = n + x.length;
1279                }
1280                float[] va = new float[n];
1281                int j = 0;
1282                for (float[] x : xs) {
1283                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1284                                va[j] = x[i];
1285                                j++;
1286                        }
1287                }               
1288                return va;
1289        }
1290
1291        /**
1292         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1293         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1294         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1295         */
1296        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1297                int n = 0;
1298                for (double[] x : xs) {
1299                        n = n + x.length;
1300                }
1301                double[] va = new double[n];    
1302                int j = 0;
1303                for (double[] x : xs) {
1304                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1305                                va[j] = x[i];
1306                                j++;
1307                        }
1308                }               
1309                return va;
1310        }
1311        
1312        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1313        
1314        /**
1315         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1316         * which must have the same length.
1317         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1318         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1319         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1320         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1321         * @return the interpolated vector
1322         */
1323        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1324                float[] c = new float[a.length];
1325                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1326                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1327                }
1328                return c;
1329        }
1330        
1331        /**
1332         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1333         * which must have the same length.
1334         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1335         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1336         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1337         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1338         * @return the interpolated vector
1339         */
1340        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1341                double[] c = new double[a.length];
1342                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1343                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1344                }
1345                return c;
1346        }
1347        
1348        
1349        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1350        
1351        /**
1352         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1353         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1354         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
1355         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1356         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1357         */
1358        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1359                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1360                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1361                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1362                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1363                }
1364                return xh;
1365        }
1366        
1367        /**
1368         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1369         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1370         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
1371         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1372         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1373         */
1374        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1375                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1376                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1377                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1378                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1379                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1380                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1381                }
1382                return xc;
1383        }
1384        
1385        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1386        
1387        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1388                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1389                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1390                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1391        }
1392        
1393        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1394                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1395                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1396                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1397        }
1398        
1399        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1400                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1401                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1402                return
1403                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1404                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1405                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1406                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1407                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1408                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1409        }
1410
1411        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1412                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1413                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1414                return 
1415                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1416                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1417                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1418                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1419                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1420                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1421        }
1422        
1423        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1424                if (!A.isSquare())
1425                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1426                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
1427        }
1428        
1429        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1430                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
1431        }
1432        
1433        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1434        
1435        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1436                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1437                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1438                if (m != n) 
1439                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1440                double s = 0;
1441                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1442                                s = s + A[i][i];
1443                }
1444                return s;
1445        }
1446        
1447        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1448        
1449        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1450                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1451                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1452                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1453                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1454                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1455                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1456                        }
1457                }
1458                return At;
1459        }
1460        
1461        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1462                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1463                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1464                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1465                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1466                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1467                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1468                        }
1469                }
1470                return At;
1471        }
1472        
1473        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
1474        
1475        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
1476                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1477                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1478                                return false;
1479                        }
1480                }
1481                return true;
1482        }
1483        
1484        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
1485                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
1486        }
1487        
1488        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
1489                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1490                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
1491                                return false;
1492                        }
1493                }
1494                return true;
1495        }
1496        
1497        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
1498                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
1499        }
1500        
1501        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
1502        
1503        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
1504                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
1505                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
1506                                return false;
1507                        }
1508                }
1509                return true;
1510        }
1511        
1512        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
1513                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
1514        }
1515        
1516        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1517        
1518        /**
1519         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1520         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1521         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1522         * @param A a square matrix
1523         * @return the inverse matrix
1524         */
1525        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1526                if (!isSquare(A))
1527                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1528                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1529                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1530        }
1531        
1532        /**
1533         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1534         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1535         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1536         * @param A a square matrix
1537         * @return the inverse matrix
1538         */
1539        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1540                if (!isSquare(A))
1541                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1542                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1543                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1544        }
1545
1546        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1547        
1548        /**
1549         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1550         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1551         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1552         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1553         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
1554         * 
1555         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1556         * @param b a vector of length n
1557         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1558         */
1559        
1560        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1561                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
1562                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
1563                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1564                }
1565                if (x == null) {
1566                        return null;
1567                }
1568                else {
1569                        return x.toArray();
1570                }
1571        }
1572        
1573        /**
1574         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1575         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
1576         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
1577         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
1578         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library
1579         * (with singularity threshold set to zero).
1580         * 
1581         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1582         * @param b a vector of length n
1583         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
1584         */
1585        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
1586                if (!A.isSquare()) {
1587                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be square");
1588                }
1589                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
1590                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1591                }
1592                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
1593                RealVector x = null;
1594                try {
1595                        x = solver.solve(b);
1596                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1597                return x;
1598        }
1599        
1600        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1601        
1602        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1603                if (x == null) {
1604                        return String.valueOf(x);
1605                }
1606                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1607                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1608                printToStream(x, strm);
1609                return bas.toString();
1610        }
1611        
1612        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1613                if (x == null) {
1614                        return String.valueOf(x);
1615                }
1616                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1617                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1618                printToStream(x, strm);
1619                return bas.toString();
1620        }
1621        
1622        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1623                if (A == null) {
1624                        return String.valueOf(A);
1625                }
1626                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1627                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1628                printToStream(A, strm);
1629                return bas.toString();
1630        }
1631        
1632        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1633                if (A == null) {
1634                        return String.valueOf(A);
1635                }
1636                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1637                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1638                printToStream(A, strm);
1639                return bas.toString();
1640        }
1641        
1642        public static String toString(RealVector x) {
1643                if (x == null) {
1644                        return String.valueOf(x);
1645                }
1646                else {
1647                        return toString(x.toArray());
1648                }
1649        }
1650        
1651        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
1652                if (A == null) {
1653                        return String.valueOf(A);
1654                }
1655                else {
1656                        return toString(A.getData());
1657                }
1658        }
1659        
1660        // --------------------
1661        
1662        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1663                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1664                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1665                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1666                        if (i > 0)
1667                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1668                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1669                }
1670                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1671                strm.flush();
1672        }
1673        
1674        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1675                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1676                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1677                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1678                        if (i == 0)
1679                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1680                        else
1681                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1682                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1683                                if (j == 0) 
1684                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1685                                else
1686                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1687                        }
1688                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1689                }
1690                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1691                strm.flush();
1692        }
1693        
1694        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1695                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1696                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1697                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1698                        if (i > 0)
1699                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1700                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1701                }
1702                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1703                strm.flush();
1704        }
1705        
1706        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1707                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1708                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1709                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1710                        if (i == 0)
1711                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1712                        else
1713                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1714                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1715                                if (j == 0) 
1716                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1717                                else
1718                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1719                        }
1720                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1721                }
1722                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1723                strm.flush();
1724        }
1725
1726        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
1727        
1728        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1729                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1730                
1731                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1732                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1733                }
1734        }
1735        
1736        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1737                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1738                
1739                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1740                        super("square matrix expected");
1741                }
1742        }
1743        
1744        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1745                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1746                
1747                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1748                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1749                }
1750        }
1751        
1752        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1753                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1754                
1755                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1756                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1757                }
1758        }
1759        
1760        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1761        
1762        public static void main(String[] args) {
1763                double s = Double.NaN;
1764                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
1765                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
1766                System.out.println((double[]) null);
1767                
1768                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
1769                                1,2,3,4,
1770                                5,6,7,8,
1771                                9,10,11,12,
1772                                13,14,15,16,
1773                                17,18,19,20);
1774                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
1775                
1776                RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
1777                System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
1778
1779        }
1780
1781}
